I do not pretend to give such a Sum; I only lend it to you. lenders.name: James
lenders.loan_because:
I see our micro-loans as a powerful catalyst for change in three ways: for the individual entrepreneur, the entrepreneur's family and community, and society at large (especially in terms of substantiating the fact that everyone can indeed make a difference).

I find it Kiva enormously elegant: we as lenders are offered a chance to create social impact while sitting in our comfy chairs at home or at the office. We barely have to lift a finger. To top it off, there is next to no financial or physical risk involved for us. So I have to ask: why aren't more people loaning? I just don't get it.
lenders.occupational_info: I work in the intersection of social change and personal change. I attempt to catalyze social innovations, which are any new ideas that resolve social, cultural, environmental or economic challenges. Generally, these ideas are profoundly systems-changing--they attack the root  causes of the problem and prevent it from occurring again.

lenders.name: James
lenders.loan_because:
I believe that as residents of this island Earth, we have a responsibility to help our fellow man.  History has shown that by and large, governments are too busy running themselves to help their citizens as much as they should.  

Governments, like many charitiable organizations end up spending the bulk of their revenue on "administrative overhead".  Check with the IRS for any charity you can think of, and you'll find that of the monies they raise, only about 10-15 percent of the funds actually arrive where they are needed.

Kiva has brilliantly utilized modern technology and a small group of volunteers to change that.  My money goes directly where it's needed.  This is one of those "If I won the lottery" situations for me.  I wish I had more to give.

Respectfully,

James A. Bohan

I have been involved in Unifem, a women’s fund at the United Nations that fosters women’s empowerment and gender equality. I was personally interested in reducing women’s poverty and exclusion in property ownership.  I think kiva.org compliments these efforts well.


I truly believe that everyone does better when everyone does better.  I am extremely grateful to kiva.org for making it easy for more people to get involved and thereby expand opportunities in developing nations.  Americans are so fortunate and I am delighted that I am able to help in some small way.
lenders.occupational_info: My full time job is to manage the investigation and cleanup of hazardous waste on military bases.  I have also done some emergency response work in Louisianna where I spent 6 weeks helping with the Hurricane Katrina relief efforts.  I have a small handmade soap company and understand the challenges of getting a business started and enabling it to prosper.

lenders.name: Andy
lenders.loan_because:
An ancient Greek philosopher once said; "something in Greek", I mean he must of said it in Greek because the guy was Greek right? Anyhoo, I don't speak Greek, but I'm sure whatever he said was really, really interesting and likely followed by a nice meal, dancing and then maybe a trip to the casino. My point is this, that life is short and even shorter for test pilots with eye hand coordination issues. I now realize in my adult life that a quarter chicken is better than no chicken and a quarter horse probably runs in circles...where was I? Oh yes, why do I loan? I loan because gifts are for giving and I've been given a lot of gifts in this life and giving gifts back to those who have not been given gifts or not gift giving givers for gifting of the....(okay, let's see...carry the seven divide by four, remove from heat, let simmer, notify next of kin...I now pronounce you...annyyone forrr moore cofffeee?).

I give because I have been blessed with the ability to recognize the opportunities in my life to give. Opportunities, it's all about opportunities. Kiva has provided me an opportunity to help people in need who I will quite likely never ever meet. And as a bonus, Kiva has also given me a chance to hopefully give you a giggle and giggles are free. All the best, Andy
lenders.occupational_info: I'm a skinny bald white guy with a gut and a sense of humor. The humor helps me earn a living writing, producing and voicing for TV.  As for the other assets I mentioned? I blame the Russians.
